column2: Beastmen are feral humanoids, cursed with twisted half-animal forms by the winds of Chaos. They are without exception cunning, cruel, and utterly devoted to their Dark Gods, these horned and stinking warrior-beasts can be found infesting many of the dark forests and trackless wastes that cover much of the world.
A Beastman without horns is usually low on the social ladder, ridiculed and despised by his betters.
This Beastman has shamelessly small horns an unfortunate condition within a Herd.
Beastmen value their leaders for the shape and size of their horns. Usually the Gors with the biggest horns tend to cut their way to leadership.
This Beastman has been blessed by the Gods with an impressive pair of horns, which gives him a good and enviable standing within the herd.
Bray Shamans are born into magic and wield it with an instinctive ease. A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds them, and when their wrath is roused, reality itself is distorted and maimed.
A Beastman that sprouts an excessively sharp, large or twisted set of horns is often acknowledged as the warherd's chief without a challenge: so obvious are the Dark God's blessings.
This Beastman's skin has encysted, forming a layer of crusty natural armour as tough as chainmail.
This Beastman's lower incisors have grown into sharp or excessively large tusks.
This Beastman has sprouted additional arms, allowing him to unleash yet more carnage upon the battlefield.

This Beastman was born with a rare and potent rune marked on his flesh, a sigil of pure savagery that marks the individual out as nothing more than a ravenous mass of muscle and fangs. Even the strongest beast will cower before the unbridled ferocity of this raging predator.
This Beastman's ebon fur appears to absorb light and draw the shadows about it into a cloak of midnight dark.
The gift of the Chaos Gods causes the recipient's skin to ooze a constant aura of vile, toxic corruption.
The Dark Gods have gifted this Beastman with acute senses, additional eyes or even an extra head, granting it unnaturally fast reactions.

Morghur, known by the Asrai as Cyanathair the Corruptor, is a powerful and ancient entity deeply revered by the Beastmen, who believed his spirit walked the world before the birth of their race, the ultimate incarnation of disorder and Chaos.
This ruler has recently thwarted the attempts of a Beastmen tribe to conquer their lands.
The Beastmen have laid waste of this province, destroying any sign of civilization they could find and setting one of their blasphemous herdstones as signature of their wicked accomplishment.
Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
Unleash your Herd upon a province, letting the Gor destroy any sign of civilization, breed and honor the Gods.
Send your herds to wreak havoc in a province, destroying anything that the civilized people hold dear and increasing your prestige as a Hordemaster.
Beastmen are countless and they gather easily whenever there's blood to be spilled.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! Can migrate along with their herds to a new land to spoil in the name of the Ruinous Powers. Be warned you will lose any land you currently own.

Beastmen need no excuse to invade new lands. §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can attack any bordering province and occupy any land around it, as far as the herds can manage.
Challenge your liege for supremacy over the Herds.
The prisoners from the last raid will be disposed of in the manner you prefer.
The call of the Corrupter is strong. You can join Morghur in his quest to destroy the pitiful Elves of Athel Loren.
[Root.GetFirstName] is your prisoner. Eating [Root.GetHerHim] could be a good way to set an example for the herd.
Issue a great offering to the gods beneath the herdstone, increasing your renown and draw more warriors under your banner.

A dangerous horde of Beastmen has been flocking in [From.GetName]. The twisted Chaos creatures are being driven into a frenzy by their flea-ridden leaders and have taken arms to overcome the province.
Once again the Corrupter has come back to life, once again hordes of Beastmen flock to his tattered banner, marching to destroy anything they find on their path.
A rabid horde of Beastmen has emerged from the wilderness threatening to spoil and destroy anything they find on their path.
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched this province, despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has left these lands, migrating with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] warherd elsewhere.

Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.

Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.
The land of [Root.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
To the victor the spoils. The Beastmen follow the strongest and, by killing the previous leader, some herds are rallying under your banner.
[From.GetFirstName] has killed [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], one of your servants, and taken [From.GetHerHis] place as leader of the Warherd.
With the death of [From.GetFirstName], you [From.GetHerHis] great horde is dividing, the various herds roaming on their own ways, seeking new places to pillage and spoil.
[From.GetFirstName] has challenged you in front of all your followers. You must defend your right to rule the Warherd.
Marshal Plunders and Increases Fame( Beastmen )
Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Your Hordemaster stands before you, ready to defend [From.GetHerHis] right to rule.
The Gods favour you! Their touch has given you clarity to see the Winds of magic.
The Gods have blessed your spawn. It shall grow to become a powerful shaman.
This province is scourged by a massive Beastmen population. It is only right that your liege fund an expedition to cleanse it from these blasphemous monsters.
I will plead for it at once.
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is scourged by a massive Beastmen infestation. Your subjects have pleaded many times for you to fund an expedition to cleanse them.
We cannot spare anything for this.
Your soldiers did their job and exterminated every last one of the Beastmen still scourging your land.
The expedition had catastrophic results: not only the Beastmen repelled your forces, the battle has sent them into a frenzy, if they gain further momentum, they might turn into a full horde.

The Ruinous Powers have touched you holding and their presence has been made apparent on your newborn [GetFromRelation]. The infant has come to life deformed, screeching from a beast's mouth. Many in your court demand for the creature to be burned immediately.

The gods have blessed your household, your newborn [GetFromRelation] shows their favour in [From.GetHerHis] proud animalistic features. Yet there are some in the court claiming the child's place is not in this world.
We'll leave it in the forest.
What shall be done with these prisoners?
The Hrrrd'stone! Brnng them to th'GODS!

You drag the tied up prisoner screaming in the middle of the herd, surrounded by the screaming jaws of your subjects. With a rough snap, you dig a bit in [From.GetHerHis] stomach. Feeling the metallic taste of blood sends you as well as the others into a frenzy and the whole pack leaps forward to devour [From.GetFirstName].
Your offering has pleased the gods. A small host of Beastmen, lured in by the lure of trophies and blood, has decided to join your herd.
Your offering has pleased the gods. A large host of Beastmen, lured in by the promise of war and slaughter, has decided to join your herd.
Your offering has pleased the gods. A band of trolls and giants have wandered into your domain and have found a temporary home around your herdstone, joining your herd.
The Gods did not favour you today. The stench of your offering has lured in a foreign herd, eager to claim your lands by force.
You try to fall back and the enemy's blade strikes true. When you come to your senses again, you realize only a couple of stumps remain where your horns used to be.
The weak inhabitants have risen up in [Root.GetName], led by a determined leader wanting to reclaim this land for their pitiable kind.
The weak inhabitants have risen up in [From.GetName], led by a determined leader wanting to reclaim this land for their pitiable kind.
The mere smell of blood can send you into a frenzy. You can hardly keep calm for an hour before your thoughts turn to violence and carnage.
The little beast in your care grows angrier each day, [From.GetSheHe] is developing a true bloodlust.
Almost everyone is stronger than you now, you've only found joy in tormenting and killing smaller animals. But one day...
The little beast in your care is developing a petty and twisted mind, taking pleasure in everyone else's suffering.
You despise being so weak and small, with no horns nor strength. You crave for the day you will be able to carve your place as rightful leader of a great herd.
The little beast in your care is restless, violently trying to carve its place amongst the other children of [From.GetHerHis] age.
Your natural inclination for violence has lately assumed a new flavour when you find yourself close to young people of the opposite gender, especially if they're beastmen like you.

The little beast in your care has developed an insatiable lust, abusing other children whenever [From.GetSheHe] manages to subdue them or, if nothing else is available, spending hours humping trees and rocks.

The Beastmen are anarchic and warmongering. Their herds never settle down in one place and as they migrate they destroy everything on their path. Each warherd is led by the strongest bull, who is often challenged for dominance by its subjects.
